instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Smashed GPU on 820-3332-a
threads.message:
Hi. Ok so weird situation here. This is my personal macbook.
its a 820-3332-a board that stopped booting all of a sudden.
i had problems with the display that would sometimes refuse to turn on after sleep.

i opened it to find the top of the gpu smashed and pieces of it all around the case. 

The machine was not dropped, moved even touched between the time it was working vs not.

is it possible that it is a coincidence and that it was working even with this chip in pieces ?

did it explode ?

i?m so confused

threads.title: Smashed GPU on 820-3332-a
threads.message: Board is (and was) not working with that damage. It happened recently, possibly from a surge on 3v3_s5 or via audio circuit. That's not the GPU, it's the PCH. RIP your board unless you feel like replacing it and cleaning the BIOS.

threads.title: Smashed GPU on 820-3332-a
threads.message: What do you mean by "cleaning the BIOS" ?

threads.title: Smashed GPU on 820-3332-a
threads.message: Once PCH is changed, ME region MUST be cleaned into BIOS...
